history.content:
1. Yes. No.

2. Meeting the requirement is enough to be accepted.

-----------------------------------------------------------------

I don't think you need to even take the other 4 classes to declare, just taking 61a/b/70 is enough to fill out the application. Graduating however, you need to take all 7 prereqs.

1. Yes. No.

2. Meeting the requirement is enough to be accepted.

children.subject:
You should probably see a department advisor about the first question.

For the second: you'll get a registration block when registering for your junior year Fall classes, which you'll need to get removed after talking to an L&S advisor about your situation.

If we are sophomore's right now that are still held by the old enrollment guidelines, can we ask to be considered under the new GPA requirement?

Also, is there a deadline for when we have to declare? I won't be able to take CS70 until this summer and I'm going to be taking CS61C in the Fall semester of my junior year. I heard somewhere that you have to declare before the end of your sophomore year :O

history.content:
This is a two-part question about applying as a CS major in L&S. First, looking through stuff online, I saw the following quote:

"Students entering UC Berkeley in fall 2015 or after fall 2015 must complete CS 61A, CS 61B, and CS 70 with a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.30 in order to petition for admission to the major."

Does this mean that our grades in the other four lower division classes do no matter, so long as we pass them? For example, if I complete the courses named above with a 3.3 GPA, does it matter if I only scraped by on my math classes? They are on the major application form, but are they taken into consideration at all?

Secondly, if I were to apply and meet whatever requirements it takes to petition, is there still a chance I would be denied on merit? Or would meeting the requirements to petition mean I would surely be accepted?
history.subject: L&S Prospective CS Major
